snippet: Adam Skelos, the son of the former State Senate majority leader, asked for an executive’s help removing a C.E.O. and threatened a bank loan officer, according to testimony on Friday during the corruption trial of Mr. Skelos and his father.
abstract: Charles Dorego of Glenwood Management gives testimony in corruption trial of former New York State Senate Majority Leader Dean G Skelos and son Adam; Dorego says younger Skelos tried to use his father's political influence to take over board position occupied by AbTech Industries chief executive Glenn R Rink.

byline.original: By WILLIAM K. RASHBAUM and SUSANNE CRAIG

lead_paragraph: Adam Skelos, the son of the former State Senate majority leader, asked for an executive’s help removing a C.E.O. and threatened a bank loan officer, according to testimony on Friday during the corruption trial of Mr. Skelos and his father.

headline.main: Skelos’s Son Wanted C.E.O. Removed in Failed Takeover Bid, Witness Says
headline.print_headline: Skelos’s Son Wanted CEO Removed in Failed Takeover Bid, Witness Says
